config_defs.name: teradata.database
config_defs.documentation: Name of a databaseType: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: teradata.url
config_defs.documentation: URL for remote databaseType: stringValid Values: URI with one of these schemes: âjdbcâImportance: high

config_defs.name: teradata.username
config_defs.documentation: Username for database authenticationType: stringImportance: high

config_defs.name: teradata.password
config_defs.documentation: Password for database authenticationType: passwordImportance: high

config_defs.name: insert.mode
config_defs.documentation: The insertion mode to use. Supported modes are:insertUse standard SQLINSERTstatements.updateUse the appropriate update semantics for the target database if it is supported by the connector, e.g.UPDATE.Type: stringDefault: insertValid Values: [insert, update]Importance: high

config_defs.name: insert
config_defs.documentation: Use standard SQLINSERTstatements.

config_defs.name: update
config_defs.documentation: Use the appropriate update semantics for the target database if it is supported by the connector, e.g.UPDATE.

config_defs.name: batch.size
config_defs.documentation: Specifies how many records to attempt to batch together for insertion into the destination table, when possible.Type: intDefault: 3000Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: table.name.format
config_defs.documentation: A format string for the destination table name, which may contain â${topic}â as a placeholder for the originating topic name.For example,kafka_${topic}for the topic âordersâ will map to the table name âkafka_ordersâ.Type: stringDefault: ${topic}Importance: medium

config_defs.name: pk.mode
config_defs.documentation: The primary key mode, also refer topk.fieldsdocumentation for interplay. Supported modes are:noneNo keys utilized.kafkaApache KafkaÂ® coordinates are used as the PK.record_keyField(s) from the record key are used, which may be a primitive or a struct.record_valueField(s) from the record value are used, which must be a struct.Type: stringDefault: noneValid Values: [none, kafka, record_key, record_value]Importance: high
config_defs.default: nonevalid values: [none, kafka, record_key, record_value]importance: high

config_defs.name: none
config_defs.documentation: No keys utilized.

config_defs.name: kafka
config_defs.documentation: Apache KafkaÂ® coordinates are used as the PK.

config_defs.name: record_key
config_defs.documentation: Field(s) from the record key are used, which may be a primitive or a struct.

config_defs.name: record_value
config_defs.documentation: Field(s) from the record value are used, which must be a struct.

config_defs.name: pk.fields
config_defs.documentation: List of comma-separated primary key field names. The runtime interpretation of this config depends on thepk.mode:noneIgnored as no fields are used as primary key in this mode.kafkaMust be a trio representing the Kafka coordinates, defaults to__connect_topic,__connect_partition,__connect_offsetif empty.record_keyIf empty, all fields from the key struct will be used, otherwise used to extract the desired fields - for primitive key only a single field name must be configured.record_valueIf empty, all fields from the value struct will be used, otherwise used to extract the desired fields.Type: listDefault: noneImportance: medium

config_defs.name: none
config_defs.documentation: Ignored as no fields are used as primary key in this mode.

config_defs.name: kafka
config_defs.documentation: Must be a trio representing the Kafka coordinates, defaults to__connect_topic,__connect_partition,__connect_offsetif empty.

config_defs.name: record_key
config_defs.documentation: If empty, all fields from the key struct will be used, otherwise used to extract the desired fields - for primitive key only a single field name must be configured.

config_defs.name: record_value
config_defs.documentation: If empty, all fields from the value struct will be used, otherwise used to extract the desired fields.

config_defs.name: fields.whitelist
config_defs.documentation: List of comma-separated record value field names. If empty, all fields from the record value are utilized, otherwise used to filter to the desired fields.Note thatpk.fieldsis applied independently in the context of which field(s) form the primary key columns in the destination database, while this configuration is applicable for the other columns.Type: listDefault: ââImportance: medium

config_defs.name: db.timezone
config_defs.documentation: Name of the JDBC timezone that should be used in the connector when inserting time-based values. Defaults to UTC.Type: stringDefault: âUTCâImportance: medium

config_defs.name: auto.create
config_defs.documentation: Whether to automatically create the destination table based on record schema if it is found to be missing by issuingCREATE.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: auto.evolve
config_defs.documentation: Whether to automatically add columns in the table schema when found to be missing relative to the record schema by issuingALTER.Type: booleanDefault: falseImportance: medium

config_defs.name: quote.sql.identifiers
config_defs.documentation: When to quote table names, column names, and other identifiers in SQL statements. For backward compatibility, the default is âalwaysâ.Type: stringDefault: ALWAYSImportance: medium

config_defs.name: max.retries
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of times to retry on errors before failing the task.Type: intDefault: 10Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait following an error before a retry attempt is made.Type: intDefault: 3000Valid Values: [0,â¦]Importance: medium

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
config_defs.documentation: A list of host/port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster used for licensing. All servers in the cluster will be discovered from the initial connection. This list should be in the form host1:port1,host2:port2,â¦. Since these servers are just used for the initial connection to discover the full cluster membership (which may change dynamically), this list need not contain the full set of servers (you may want more than one, though, in case a server is down).Type: listImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic
config_defs.documentation: Name of the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information.Type: stringDefault: _confluent-commandImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. This is used only if the topic does not already exist, and the default of 3 is appropriate for production use. If you are using a development environment with less than 3 brokers, you must set this to the number of brokers (often 1).Type: intDefault: 3Importance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and
paste as the value forconfluent.license. A trial license allows using the connector for a 30-day trial period. A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password for the trust store file. If a password is not set access to the truststore is still available, but
integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.security.protocol
config_defs.documentation: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Valid values are: PLAINTEXT, SSL, SASL_PLAINTEXT, SASL_SSL.Type: stringDefault: âPLAINTEXTâImportance: medium

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and

config_defs.name: confluent.topic
config_defs.documentation: Name of the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information.Type: stringDefault: _confluent-commandImportance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: The replication factor for the Kafka topic used for Confluent Platform configuration, including licensing information. This is used only if the topic does not already exist, and the default of 3 is appropriate for production use. If you are using a development environment with less than 3 brokers, you must set this to the number of brokers (often 1).Type: intDefault: 3Importance: low

config_defs.name: confluent.license
config_defs.documentation:
Confluent issues enterprise license keys to each subscriber. The license key is text that you can copy and
paste as the value forconfluent.license. A trial license allows using the connector for a 30-day trial period. A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.location

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.key.password

config_defs.documentation: No keys utilized.

config_defs.documentation: Field(s) from the record key are used, which may be a primitive or a struct.

config_defs.name: pk.fields
config_defs.documentation: List of comma-separated primary key field names. The runtime interpretation of this config depends on thepk.mode:noneIgnored as no fields are used as primary key in this mode.kafkaMust be a trio representing the Kafka coordinates, defaults to__connect_topic,__connect_partition,__connect_offsetif empty.record_keyIf empty, all fields from the key struct will be used, otherwise used to extract the desired fields - for primitive key only a single field name must be configured.record_valueIf empty, all fields from the value struct will be used, otherwise used to extract the desired fields.Type: listDefault: noneImportance: medium

A developer license allows using the connector indefinitely for single-broker development environments.If you are a subscriber, contact Confluent Support for more information.Type: stringDefault: ââValid Values: Confluent Platform licenseImportance: high
config_defs.default: ââvalid values: confluent platform licenseimportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.truststore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the trust store file.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation:
The password for the trust store file. If a password is not set access to the truststore is still available, but
integrity checking is disabled.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.location
config_defs.documentation: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.Type: stringDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file. This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.Type: passwordDefault: nullImportance: high

config_defs.name: confluent.topic.security.protocol
config_defs.documentation: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Valid values are: PLAINTEXT, SSL, SASL_PLAINTEXT, SASL_SSL.Type: stringDefault: âPLAINTEXTâImportance: medium

config_defs.name: Search by configuration property name
config_defs.documentation: Enter a string to search and filter by configuration property name.

config_defs.name: name
config_defs.documentation: Globally unique name to use for this connector.

config_defs.name: connector.class
config_defs.documentation: Name or alias of the class for this connector. Must be a subclass of org.apache.kafka.connect.connector.Connector. If the connector is org.apache.kafka.connect.file.FileStreamSinkConnector, you can either specify this full name,  or use âFileStreamSinkâ or âFileStreamSinkConnectorâ to make the configuration a bit shorter

config_defs.name: tasks.max
config_defs.documentation: Maximum number of tasks to use for this connector.

config_defs.name: topics
config_defs.documentation: List of topics to consume, separated by commas

config_defs.name: topics.regex
config_defs.documentation: Regular expression giving topics to consume. Under the hood, the regex is compiled to ajava.util.regex.Pattern. Only one of topics or topics.regex should be specified.

config_defs.name: tasks.max.enforce
config_defs.documentation: (Deprecated) Whether to enforce that the tasks.max property is respected by the connector. By default, connectors that generate too many tasks will fail, and existing sets of tasks that exceed the tasks.max property will also be failed. If this property is set to false, then connectors will be allowed to generate more than the maximum number of tasks, and existing sets of tasks that exceed the tasks.max property will be allowed to run. This property is deprecated and will be removed in an upcoming major release.

config_defs.name: key.converter
config_defs.documentation: Converter class used to convert between Kafka Connect format and the serialized form that is written to Kafka. This controls the format of the keys in messages written to or read from Kafka, and since this is independent of connectors it allows any connector to work with any serialization format. Examples of common formats include JSON and Avro.

config_defs.name: value.converter
config_defs.documentation: Converter class used to convert between Kafka Connect format and the serialized form that is written to Kafka. This controls the format of the values in messages written to or read from Kafka, and since this is independent of connectors it allows any connector to work with any serialization format. Examples of common formats include JSON and Avro.

config_defs.name: header.converter
config_defs.documentation: HeaderConverter class used to convert between Kafka Connect format and the serialized form that is written to Kafka. This controls the format of the header values in messages written to or read from Kafka, and since this is independent of connectors it allows any connector to work with any serialization format. Examples of common formats include JSON and Avro. By default, the SimpleHeaderConverter is used to serialize header values to strings and deserialize them by inferring the schemas.

config_defs.name: config.action.reload
config_defs.documentation: The action that Connect should take on the connector when changes in external configuration providers result in a change in the connectorâs configuration properties. A value of ânoneâ indicates that Connect will do nothing. A value of ârestartâ indicates that Connect should restart/reload the connector with the updated configuration properties.The restart may actually be scheduled in the future if the external configuration provider indicates that a configuration value will expire in the future.

config_defs.name: transforms
config_defs.documentation: Aliases for the transformations to be applied to records.

config_defs.name: predicates
config_defs.documentation: Aliases for the predicates used by transformations.

config_defs.name: errors.retry.timeout
config_defs.documentation: The maximum duration in milliseconds that a failed operation will be reattempted. The default is 0, which means no retries will be attempted. Use -1 for infinite retries.

config_defs.name: errors.retry.delay.max.ms
config_defs.documentation: The maximum duration in milliseconds between consecutive retry attempts. Jitter will be added to the delay once this limit is reached to prevent thundering herd issues.

config_defs.name: errors.tolerance
config_defs.documentation: Behavior for tolerating errors during connector operation. ânoneâ is the default value and signals that any error will result in an immediate connector task failure; âallâ changes the behavior to skip over problematic records.

config_defs.name: errors.log.enable
config_defs.documentation: If true, write each error and the details of the failed operation and problematic record to the Connect application log. This is âfalseâ by default, so that only errors that are not tolerated are reported.

config_defs.name: errors.log.include.messages
config_defs.documentation: Whether to include in the log the Connect record that resulted in a failure. For sink records, the topic, partition, offset, and timestamp will be logged. For source records, the key and value (and their schemas), all headers, and the timestamp, Kafka topic, Kafka partition, source partition, and source offset will be logged. This is âfalseâ by default, which will prevent record keys, values, and headers from being written to log files.

config_defs.name: errors.deadletterqueue.topic.name
config_defs.documentation: The name of the topic to be used as the dead letter queue (DLQ) for messages that result in an error when processed by this sink connector, or its transformations or converters. The topic name is blank by default, which means that no messages are to be recorded in the DLQ.

config_defs.name: errors.deadletterqueue.topic.replication.factor
config_defs.documentation: Replication factor used to create the dead letter queue topic when it doesnât already exist.

config_defs.name: errors.deadletterqueue.context.headers.enable
config_defs.documentation: If true, add headers containing error context to the messages written to the dead letter queue. To avoid clashing with headers from the original record, all error context header keys, all error context header keys will start with__connect.errors.
